metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14598 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in XListExtensions in ListExt.c in libX11 through 1.6.5. A malicious server can send a reply in which the first string overflows, causing a variable to be set to NULL that will be freed later on, leading to DoS (segmentation fault).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14598` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libx11-6 - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.1
libx11-data - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.1
libx11-xcb1 - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libx11 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.1').
